summary:
Constantine Koukias is a producer of music, opera, and film.

Based in Amsterdam since 2013, he has created productions for the stage and screen ranging from large-scale music theatre and opera to mobile installation art and digital events.

His production-design credits from a career spanning over four decades include the internationally acclaimed Days and Nights with Christ (1990), To Traverse Water (1992), MIKROVION (Small Life – 36 Images in a Phantom Flux of Life) (1994), Medea (1995), Odyssey (1995), PULP – An Industrial Opera (1996), The Divine Kiss (1998), Sea Chant (2001), Tesla – Lightning in His Hand (2003), The Barbarians (2013), Backwards from Winter (2018), and A Deep Black Sleep (2023). 

In 1993, he was commissioned by the Sydney Opera House Trust to compose the large-scale music-theatre piece ICON, in celebration of the building’s twentieth anniversary. 

He has been commissioned by the Museum of Old and New Art (MONA) in Hobart, Tasmania, for Kimisis – Falling Asleep (2010), The Barbarians (2013), and Before the Flame Goes Out (2017). A Deep Black Sleep, a film-noir opera, premiered at the MONA FOMA festival in 2023.

Since 2018, Koukias has produced two short films: A Day in June (2018; dir. Peter Seiben) and The Pain of Others (2023; dir. Slaviša Drobnjaković). He is currently in planning and pre-production stages for Eros & Thanatos (2024; dir. Drobnjaković) and Shaped by Trees (written by Biasino Pezzimenti).

From 2024–2027, he will be producing a series of documentaries and performances for the new work Primordial.

In an iconic line-up of Tasmanian creative energies, Tasdance presented new dance works by two of Australia's leading choreographers: Forty Miles - A River of Dreams by Graeme Murphy and Chrissie Parrott's work Racing Heart. Heart Matters premiered a new musical commission by Constantine Koukias (Artistic Director of IHOS Opera) and Carl Vine's Tribe's Desire, rearranged especially for this project and performed live by the Tasmanian Symphony Orchestra and conducted by Kenneth Young.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Kimisis - Falling Asleep', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'Commissioned by MONA FOMA - Brian Ritchie
KIMISIS – Falling Asleep (Greek: Κοίμησις ) is a gallery-style installation work celebrating a Great Feast of the Eastern Orthodox Church which commemorates the Dormition – the “falling asleep”, or death and assumption into Heaven – of Mary, the mother of Christ. The word akathistos literally means “not sitting”, i.e. standing; normally all participants stand while it is being prayed. In this work, the soprano performs on a Pilates Trapeze Machine which provides the platform for the Dormition, a state of passing through repose into the realm of the eternal.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': "China National Symphony Orchestra - 'Within a Prayer at Lamplighting'", 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2002}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2002}}, 'description': 'Australian National Tour to commemorate thirty years of diplomatic ties with China', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Prayer Bells - Pentekostarion', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}}, 'description': 'Chicago Cultural Centre 2010
National Tour 2007
Festival of Voices 2006
Launceston Tour 2005
Federation Festival Melbourne 2001 Premiere Commission 

Originally commissioned for Australia’s Centenary of Federation, Prayer Bells comprises 21 prayers for three solo cantors, eight male voices and a set of specially cast quarter-tone bells.  An intimate work of contemporary vocal reverence, Prayer Bells is A choral concert piece that calls to a spectrum of religious and ethnic experience. 
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Odyssey - Production Designer', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}}, 'description': 'Melbourne International Festival of the Arts 
"Odyssey" is a melange of mime and pantomime, puppetry and slapstick, song and dance.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Days and Nights with Christ', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1990}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1990}}, 'description': 'Salamanca Arts Festival - World Premiere 1990
Sydney Festival - Tour 1992
Hobart Re Staging 1997
An opera in three parts, sung in ecclesiastical and modern Greek, that explores imagery associated with the schizophrenic condition, Days and Nights with Christ is for four solo singers, and a dancer (Christ). Musicians, electro-acoustic instruments, winds and brass stand on a podium close to the audience: placed in this way, they bind spectators and performers. The spectators are seated in two tiers that face each other, and the Christ figure between mirrors them all. Combining narrative skills with a wide range of digital media, Roar content engages and communicates right across the entertainment, education and corporate sectors.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Guest Composer - 1000 Doors 1000 Windows 2007', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': "Sound for the 1000 Doors 1000 Windows tour - Melbourne, Tasmania, Mildura, Adelaide, Canberra.
'This was a virtuoso performance by the Soprano Xenia Hanusiak, a sequence of three challenging compositions which lasted nearly an hour.
The music was by Constantine Koukias and Paris based Kaija Saariaho, with the collaboration of artists Cazerine Barry (video) and Bob Scott (sound).
The first work, Koukias' Incantation II was an evocation where the voice was cleverly manipulated by electronic means.

Saariaho's Lonh had a text loosely based on a poem by the Mediaval Troubadour Jauffre Rudel in Provencal, English and French, while the final work ' A thousand doors, a thousand windows was devised by Xenia Hanusiak
The combination of the voice, pre-recorded music of Koukias and the image of Cazerine Barry was evocative and at times hypnotic....'", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Guest Composer ICON - Sydney Opera House 1993', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Music Director & Composer. Constantine Koukias - Within a Prayer at Lamplighting. Also works by Tan Dun, Zhu Jian'er, Qin Yi and Curran. Dinner by Kylie Kwong.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'MIKROVION (Small Life 36 Images in a Phantom Flux of Life) 1994', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The three-hour opera is in five parts and its 1994 premiere in Hobart, Tasmania, featured 16 principal performers, 7 musicians, 20 men and women in the vocal choruses, a semaphore chorus of 11 high school students as "the voice of God", a creative team of 11 and a production team of 24.

Described by one writer as a "microscopic epic",MIKROVION takes its title from the classical Greek for "small life" - in this case HIV.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Medea - A Hybrid work for the stage 1994', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'State Theatre of South Australia', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'PULP - An Industrial Opera 1996', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'To commemorate its sixtieth anniversary, the Associated Pulp and Paper Mills at Burnie commissioned Pulp, an industrial opera, and 2001 saw Sea chant � settlers, ships and sawhorses, a community opera telling the history of the east coast. Established in 2000, IHOS Music Theatre Laboratory develops music theatre skills of young Tasmanians through developing choral and dramatic works complete with movement, staging and lighting.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Rapture - A Sonic Taxi Performance 1996', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Constantine', 'last_name': 'Koukias', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director / Producer'}]}]
